Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: DIRECTIONAL SURVEY IDENTIFIER: Number uniquely identifying each DirectionalSurvey. Assign as a unique value (for example a sequence number) for either 1)unique to each given UWI and SOURCE, 2) unique to each UWI, regardless ofSOURCE, or 3) unique to each WELL_DIR_SRVY record, regardless of UWI and/orSOURCE. This attribute should not be used to store or have any relation to "RunNumbers" (SURVEY_RUN_NUM) or "Reference numbers/identifiers/etc."(SURVEY_REF_NUM) associated with a given survey because it is part of the tablePrimary Key. If it were used to store "Run Numbers" or "Referencenumbers/identifiers/etc.", then it would not be possible to store two versions of agiven survey having the same "Run Number" or "Reference number/identifier/etc."(for example, two different X/Y Offset calculation methods).
Column Comment.2: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyactive or valid. If a given WELL_DIR_SRVY records is identified as Inactive (i.e.WELL_DIR_SRVY.ACTIVE_IND='N'), then the survey stations inWELL_DIR_SRVY_STATION corresponding to the same UWI, SURVEY_ID andSOURCE are by default also implied/assumed to be Inactive, regardless of the valueassigned to their WELL_DIR_SRVY_STATION.ACTIVE_IND.
Column Comment.4: AZIMUTH COORDINATE SYSTEM ID: Coordinate Reference System ID that bestidentifies the CRS of the WELL_DIR_SRVY_STATION.AZIMUTH values. Use toidenfity Geodetic Datum if North Reference (AZIMUTH_NORTH_TYPE) is True; anappropriate Cartesian CRS ID for Grid North Reference; leave NULL for MagneticNorth Reference.
Column Comment.5: AZIMUTH COORDINATE SYSTEM QUALIFIER: Qualifier assigning an appropriatelevel of confidence of the reliability of the value stored inAZIMUTH_COORD_SYSTEM_ID, such as VERIFIED, STATED, INFERRED,ASSUMED, UNKNOWN, etc. For example, if the CRS is clearly, completely andaccurately defined in the Directional Survey header, and can be verified as beingcorrect, assign 'VERIFIED'. If, however, the some of all of the CRS information is notexplicitly stated, but can be assumed based on other information such as othersurveys performed during the same time frame in the same area by the same surveyaquisition company, a qualifier such as 'ASSUMED' might be more accurate. Refer tothe descriptions of specific values in the corresponding reference table.
Column Comment.6: AZIMUTH COORDINATE SYSTEM REMARK: Remarks about Azimuth CoordinateReference System. Since the key components of the CRS (Datum, Type, Zone andUOM) are usually NOT well defined or are only partially defined in directional surveyreport or header, use this attribute to identify these key components, along withdescriptions whether each is Correctly Stated, Inferred from other information,Assumed, Unknown, etc. Examples of these key components incude: Datum(NAD27, NAD83, WGS84, ...), Type (Lambert, UTM, ...), Zone (1702, 14, ...) andUnits of Measure (Feet, Meters).
Column Comment.7: AZIMUTH CORRECTION ANGLE: Correction Angle that was ADDED to priorAzimuths (RPT_AZIMUTH) to correct them to the stored AZIMUTH, stored as apositive or negative value with NO corresponding E/W Direction indicator attribute.For example, if the stored Azimuth (AZIMUTH) values are referenced to True Northand the reported Azimuth (RPT_AZIMUTH) values are referenced to Grid North, theformula used to correct the reported values is: RPT_AZIMUTH +AZIMUTH_CORR_ANGLE = AZIMUTH (conversely, to determine the reportedvalues: AZIMUTH - AZIMUTH_CORR_ANGLE = RPT_AZIMUTH). In this example,the AZIMUTH_CORR_ANGLE_TYPE would be set to the code describing a"Grid-to-True" correction angle.
Column Comment.8: AZIMUTH CORRECTION ANGLE OUOM: Azimuth correction angle original unit ofmeasure.
Column Comment.9: AZIMUTH CORRECTION ANGLE TYPE: Defines the type of correction angle usedto correct the prior Azimuth (RPT_AZIMUTH) values to the stored AZIMUTH values(i.e. Grid-to-True, Magnetic-to-Grid, etc.). Applies to the AZIMUTH_CORR_ANGLEfield. Set to "NONE" if NO correction was applied.
Column Comment.10: AZIMUTH NORTH TYPE: The North reference used to define AZIMUTH angularmeasurement values stored in WELL_DIR_SRVY_STATION for this DirectionalSurvey (UWI, SURVEY_ID, SOURCE). For example, True North, Grid North,Magnetic North, etc. Include Qualifier in the value - e.g. 'TRUE' vs. 'INFERREDTRUE' vs. 'ASSUME TRUE'.
Column Comment.11: SURVEY BASE DEPTH: Measured depth in borehole of the LAST surveyed station.If a stored survey has been extrapolated to a deeper depth than the last surveyedstation, enter the deepest extrapolated measured depth in EXTRAPOLATE_DEPTH.
Column Comment.12: SURVEY BASE OUOM: Survey base depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.13: COMPUTE METHOD: Calculation Method used to computetheWELL_DIR_SRVY_STATION TVD, X_OFFSET, Y_OFFSET andDOG_LEG_SEVERITY values for this Directional Survey (UWI, SURVEY_ID,SOURCE). For example, Radius of Curvature, Minimum Curvature, BalancedTangential, etc.
Column Comment.14: CONFIDENTIAL TYPE: Describes the type of confidentiality of this survey. Forexample TIGHT, OPEN, etc. The Directional Survey confidentiality my differ from thegeneral WELL confidentiality.
Column Comment.15: COORDINATE ACQUISITION ID: Identifies an assembly of coordinate data thatmust be grouped together. The coordinate data should be acquired together at thesame time, from the same source, using the same method (theoretical, metes andbounds, paced off, GPS, scanned from base map, etc.) and at the same accuracy.May be used to indicate the level of accuracy of a set of coordinates.
Column Comment.16: DIRECTIONAL SURVEY CLASS: Class of this directional survey. For example,"Directional Survey" (where MD, Inclination and Azimuth are all measured) vs."Position Log" (where Inclination and Azimuth are both null and only MD, TVD andX/Y Offsets are available). This attribute may also be used to identify "PROPOSED"or "PLANNED" surveys.
Column Comment.17: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.18: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.19: EXTRAPOLATE DEPTH: The depth to which the segment was extrapolated.
Column Comment.20: EXTRAPOLATE DEPTH OUOM: Extrapolate depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.21: EXTRAPOLATE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag to indicate if extrapolation to anon-surveyed depth occurred. Only applicable to CALCULATED surveys.
Column Comment.22: LATITUDE/LONGITUDE COORDINATE SYSTEM ID: Coordinate Reference SystemID defining the Geodetic Datum of the WELL_DIR_SRVY_STATION LATITUDE andLONGITUDE values. If LATITUDE and LONGITUDE attributes inWELL_DIR_SRVY_STATION are stored, clearly identifying thier Datum is required.
Column Comment.23: LOCAL COORDINATE SYSTEM IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the localcoordinate system, such as a local grid system (ATS, STS, MTS etc) to which thesecoordinates have been referenced. Relevant in places where the legal surveylocation is referenced to a physical marker (like a survey pin) located in a physicalplace (such as the NE Corner of a section). In places where the mapping system isnot exactly synchronized with the real ground coordinates, it's important tounderstand which local reference system references are made to. Coordinates thatare referenced to a local coordinate system are usually surveyed relative to the localsystem using metes and bounds or local survey references; maintaining the positionof each point relative to its referenced local system is very important to surveyaccuracy. Also, some local coordinate systems may change over time, so it is criticalto keep track of which local coordinate system was used at the time the survey wasacquired.
Column Comment.24: MAGNETIC DECLINATION: Value for the declination angle measured FROM Truenorth TO the Magnetic referenced north at the survey location. This value can bestored in one of two methods - 1) Store as a positive/negative number and ignoreMAGNETIC_DECLINATION_EW_DIR, or 2) Store as an absolute value number anduse MAGNETIC_DECLINATION_EW_DIR to identify if the value is positive (E) ornegative (W).
Column Comment.25: MAGNETIC DECLINATION OUOM: Magnetic Declination angle original unit ofmeasure.
Column Comment.26: MAGNETIC DECLINATION EAST-WEST DIRECTION: East-West direction indicatorfor MAGNETIC_DECLINATION angle.
Column Comment.27: OFFSET COORDINATE SYSTEM ID: Coordinate Reference System ID that bestidentifies the CRS of the WELL_DIR_SRVY_STATION X_OFFSET, Y_OFFSET,CLOSURE_DIST and VERTICAL_SECTION values. Use to idenfity Geodetic Datumif North Reference (OFFSET_NORTH_TYPE) is True; an appropriate Cartesian CRSID for Grid North Reference; leave NULL for Magnetic North Reference. TheCoordinate Reference System. for the Offsets CAN BE different from the AZIMUTHCoordinate Reference System.
Column Comment.28: OFFSET COORDINATE SYS QUALIFIER: Qualifier assigning an appropriate level ofconfidence of the reliability of the value stored in OFFSET_COORD_SYSTEM_ID,such as VERIFIED, STATED, INFERRED, ASSUMED, UNKNOWN, etc. Refer to theAZIMUTH_COORD_SYS_QUALIFIER Column Comments for additional details.
Column Comment.29: OFFSET COORDINATE SYSYEM REMARK: Remarks about Offset CoordinateReference System. Refer to the AZIMUTH_COORD_SYS_REMARK ColumnComments for additional details.
Column Comment.30: OFFSET NORTH TYPE: The North reference of the WELL_DIR_SRVYPLANE_OF_PROPOSAL and WELL_DIR_SRVY_STATION X_OFFSET,Y_OFFSET, CLOSURE_DIST_DIR and VERTICAL_SECTION values for thisDirectional Survey (UWI, SURVEY_ID, SOURCE). For example, True North, GridNorth, etc. Include Qualifier in the value - e.g. 'TRUE' vs. 'INFERRED TRUE' vs.'ASSUME TRUE'. The North Reference for the Offsets CAN BE different from theAZIMUTH North Reference.
Column Comment.31: PLANE OF PROPOSAL: The direction angle of a horizontal line from the surveyorigin (Well surface location) to the planned or intended target. This value should bea number between 0.00 and 360.00 degrees; 0.00 and 360.00 represent North, 90.00is East, 180.00 is South and 270.00 is West. The Plane of Proposal angle NorthReference is defined by WELL_DIR_SRVY.OFFSET_NORTH_TYPE and CRS byWELL_DIR_SRVY.OFFSET_COORD_SYSTEM_ID. This attribute is used in thecalculations for WELL_DIR_SRVY_STATION.VERTICAL_SECTION. Also oftenreferred to as: "Vertical Section Direction", "Vertical Section Azimuth", "ProposedBottomhole Location (PBHL)", or "Target Direction". Since PLANE_OF_PROPOSALis an azimuth number between 0.00 and 360.00 degrees, there is no need for acorresponding PLANE_OF_PROPOSAL_EW_DIR attribute.
Column Comment.32: PLANE OF PROPOSAL OUOM: Plane of proposal original unit of measure.
Column Comment.33: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.34: PREFERRED INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this survey is the preferredDirectional Survey for the UWI. Only one row per UWI should have thePREFERRED_IND flag set to "Y", All other surveys for the same UWI should havePREFERRED_IND set to "N". Raw, unprocessed surveys should not havePREFERRED_IND set to "Y".
Column Comment.35: RADIUS OF UNCERTAINTY DISTANCE: The radius of uncertainty distance of thebottom hole location caused primarily by sections of the wellbore where onlyinclination data exists.
Column Comment.36: RADIUS OF UNCERTAINTY DISTANCE OUOM: Radius of Uncertainty Distanceoriginal unit of measure.
Column Comment.37: RADIUS OF UNCERTAINTY DISTANCE REASON: Reason for Radius ofUncertainty.
Column Comment.38: RECORD MODE: Record Mode for this Directional Survey. For example, multi shot,single shot, etc.
Column Comment.39: REMARK: Remarks pertaining to the directional survey operations.
Column Comment.40: REPORTED HEIGHT ABOVE PERMANENT DATUM: The height of the log datumAbove the reported Permanent Datum (APD), as reported by the source of this row.Reference APD in LAS format. To adjust a reported depth to the reported permanentdatum, compute e.g. LOG DATUM ELEV - PERMANENT DATUM ELEV.
Column Comment.41: REPORTED LOG DATUM: The datum from which the log depths are measured. Thepoint at which log depth equals zero, e.g. kelly bushing. Reference DREF in LASformat.
Column Comment.42: REPORTED LOG DATUM ELEVATION: The elevation of the LOG_DATUM, asreported by the source of this row. Reference EREF in LAS format.
Column Comment.44: REPORTED PERMANENT DATUM: The permanent datum as reported by thesource of this row. Reference PDAT in LAS format. Generally, this value should bethe same as WELL.DEPTH_DATUM, but in rare cases it may be different.
Column Comment.45: REPORTED PERMANENT DATUM ELEVATION: The reported elevation of thepermanent datum. This should be the same as WELL.DEPTH_DATUM_ELEV, but inrare cases it may be different. Reference EPD in LAS.
Column Comment.46: REPORTED PERMANENT DATUM ELEVATION ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE:
Column Comment.47: RESAMPLE INTERVAL: A re-sampling of original hardcopy or digital data to reducecertain types of surveys that have an excessive number of points or where the stationintervals are too small. Normally only used with dipmeter data or other interpolatedsurveys where station spacing ranges from 1-20 ft.
Column Comment.48: ORIGINAL UNIT OF MEASURE for this row of data
Column Comment.49: REPORT COORDINATE SYSTEM ID: Coordinate Reference System ID that bestidentifies the CRS of the WELL_DIR_SRVY_STATION.RPT_AZIMUTH values. Useto idenfity Geodetic Datum if North Reference (RPT_NORTH_TYPE) is True; anappropriate Cartesian CRS ID for Grid North Reference; leave NULL for MagneticNorth Reference.
Column Comment.50: REPORT COORDINATE SYSTEM QUALIFIER: Qualifier assigning an appropriatelevel of confidence of the reliability of the value stored inRPT_COORD_SYSTEM_ID, such as VERIFIED, STATED, INFERRED, ASSUMED,UNKNOWN, etc. Refer to the AZIMUTH_COORD_SYS_QUALIFIER ColumnComments for additional details.
Column Comment.51: REPORT COORDINATE SYSTEM REMARK: Remarks about RPT_AZIMUTHCoordinate Reference System. Refer to the AZIMUTH_COORD_SYS_REMARKColumn Comments for additional details.
Column Comment.52: REPORT CORRECTION ANGLE: Report Correction Angle, as defined in theDirectional Survey Report, hardcopy, PDF, etc.; stored as a positive or negativevalue with NO corresponding E/W Direction indicator attribute.
Column Comment.53: REPORT CORRECTION ANGLE OUOM: Report correction angle original unit ofmeasure.
Column Comment.54: REPORT CORRECTION ANGLE TYPE: Defines the type of Report Correction Angle(i.e. Grid-to-True, Magnetic-to-Grid, etc.). Applies to the RPT_CORR_ANGLE field.
Column Comment.55: REPORT NORTH TYPE: The North reference used to define RPT_AZIMUTHangular measurement values stored in WELL_DIR_SRVY_STATION for thisDirectional Survey (UWI, SURVEY_ID, SOURCE). For example, True North, GridNorth, Magnetic North, etc. Include Qualifier in the value - e.g. 'TRUE' vs.'INFERRED TRUE' vs. 'ASSUME TRUE'.
Column Comment.56: REPORT SURVEY TYPE: Type of Tool or Equipment used to acquire the Reported(raw, original) Directional Survey; For example, gyroscopic, magnetic, MWD, totco,acid bottle, etc. Only applicable for RAW surveys.
Column Comment.57: REPORT TIE AZIMUTH: The UNPROCESSED or Original azimuth at the measureddepth of a tie point.
Column Comment.58: REPORT TIE AZIMUTH OUOM: Report tie azimuth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.59: REPORT TIE INCLINATION: The inclination at the measured depth of a tie point.
Column Comment.60: REPORT TIE INCLINATION OUOM: Report tie inclination original unit of measure.
Column Comment.61: REPORT TIE MD: Tie-point Depth measured along the borehole from theMeasurement Reference Datum to the survey station.
Column Comment.62: REPORT TIE MD OUOM: Report tie measued depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.63: REPORT TIE POINT INDICATOR: A Y/N Flag indicating the the Tie-Point is requiredto exist for this survey. Set to 'Y' if a Tie-Point is required, set to 'N' if NO Tie-Point isrequired, or leave NULL if Tie-Point requirement is unknown.
Column Comment.64: REPORT TIE TVD: The true vertical depth at the measured depth tie point of areferenced tie.
Column Comment.65: REPORT TIE TVD OUOM: Report tie true vertical depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.66: REPORT TIE X OFFSET: The initial east/west offset distance of a directional surveywhere some or all of the interval above the first survey point is missing. This valuecan be stored in one of two methods - 1) Store as a positive/negative number andignore the corresponding RPT_TIE_X_OFFSET_EW_DIR or 2) Store as an absolutevalue number and use RPT_TIE_X_OFFSET_EW_DIR to identify if the value ispositive (E) or negative (W).
Column Comment.67: REPORT TIE X OFFSET EAST-WEST DIRECTION: Direction (East or West) of theRPT_TIE_X_OFFSET
Column Comment.68: REPORT TIE X OFFSET OUOM: Report tie X offset original unit of measure.
Column Comment.69: REPORT TIE Y OFFSET: The initial north/south offset distance of a directionalsurvey where some or all of the interval above the first survey point is missing. Thisvalue can be stored in one of two methods - 1) Store as a positive/negative numberand ignore the corresponding RPT_TIE_Y_OFFSET_NS_DIR or 2) Store as anabsolute value number and use RPT_TIE_Y_OFFSET_NS_DIR to identify if thevalue is positive (N) or negative (S).
Column Comment.70: REPORT TIE Y OFFSET NORTH-SOUTH DIRECTION: Direction (North or South) ofthe RPT_TIE_Y_OFFSET
Column Comment.71: REPORT TIE Y OFFSET OUOM: Report tie Y offset original unit of measure.
Column Comment.72: SOURCE DOCUMENT: A list of documents that are used as the source for supplyingdata. Source documents may include government and regulatory forms, operatorreports or scout tickets, publications, news letters, books or jounals.
Column Comment.73: SURVEY COMPANY BUSINESS ASSOCIATE ID: BUSINESS_ASSOCIATE codeidentifying the individual, company, agency or source that ACQUIRED this surveydata.
Column Comment.74: SURVEY COMPILER BUSINESS ASSOCIATE ID: BUSINESS_ASSOCIATE codeidentifying the company compiling the survey report. May be same asSURVEY_COMPANY_BA_ID if the company who Aqcuired the data also Compiledit, but if a different company Compiled data originally Acquired by one or more othercompanies, then this value would be different from SURVEY_COMPANY_BA_ID.
Column Comment.75: SURVEY DIGITAL PROVIDER BUSINESS ASSOCIATE ID:BUSINESS_ASSOCIATE code identifying the individual, company, agency or sourcethat provided the survey data in a digital form. This may or may not be the same asthe company who acquired the data, compiled the data, or provided a report(hard-copy, PDF, etc.) of the survey.
Column Comment.76: SURVEY END DATE: Date the directional survey was conducted if the survey wasstarted and finished the same day, else the date that the survey was completed.SURVEY_START_DATE must be Equal to or Earlier than SURVEY_END_DATE.Recommended that both SURVEY_START_DATE and SURVEY_END_DATE arepopulated, even if they are the same.
Column Comment.77: SURVEY END DATE QUALIFIER: Qualifier assigning an appropriate level ofconfidence of the reliability of the Survey End Date (SURVEY_END_DATE), such asVERIFIED, STATED, INFERRED, ASSUMED, UNKNOWN, etc.
Column Comment.78: SURVEY PROCESS METHOD: The processing method of the reported (originalhardcopy, PDF, etc.) data: interpolated, non-interpolated or mixed.
Column Comment.79: SURVEY QUALITY: Subjective qualifier for the quality of the directional survey.
Column Comment.80: SURVEY REFERENCE NUMBER: Unique or Distinctive Survey Reference Number,Job Number, File Number, Identifier, Label, Name, etc. as indicated on a directionalsurvey report, file, etc. Use this attribute to allow correlation of the data in thisDirectional Survey back to the original source document, file, etc.
Column Comment.81: SURVEY REPORT TYPE: The type of report for this survey. Use this to identify anindividual survey run (RUN); a survey containing multiple runs combined together(COMBINED RUN); or a survey that has been re-processed, corrected, validated andcomposited from either a single or multiple runs (COMPOSITE).
Column Comment.82: SURVEY RUN NUMBER: Survey Run Number, null in WELL_DIR_SRVY if multipleruns are combined/composited. Run number is typically NOT explicitly stated on agiven directional survey report, but is often assigned when multiple survey runs areevaluated, processes and/or composited.
Column Comment.83: SURVEY START DATE: Date the directional survey was conducted if the survey wasstarted and finished the same day, else the date that the survey was Started.SURVEY_START_DATE must be Equal to or Earlier than SURVEY_END_DATE.Recommended that both SURVEY_START_DATE and SURVEY_END_DATE arepopulated, even if they are the same.
Column Comment.84: SURVEY START DATE QUALIFIER: Qualifier assigning an appropriate level ofconfidence of the reliability of the Survey Start Date (SURVEY_START_DATE), suchas VERIFIED, STATED, INFERRED, ASSUMED, UNKNOWN, etc.
Column Comment.85: SURVEY TYPE: Type of Tool or Equipment used to acquire this Directional Survey.For example, gyroscopic, magnetic, MWD, totco, acid bottle, etc.
Column Comment.86: SURVEY TOP DEPTH: Measured depth in wellbore where the directional surveystarts. This value should equal the Minimum WELL_DIR_SRVY_STATION.MD forthis Directional Survey (UWI, SURVEY_ID, SOURCE), regardless of whether theMinimum WELL_DIR_SRVY_STATION.MD represents an actual surveyed MD ornot.
Column Comment.87: SURVEY TOP OUOM: Survey top depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.88: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.89: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.90: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.91: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.92: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.93: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.94: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
